alert.note: Alert for Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 25 at 9:35PM CDT until October 25 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Dallas and Tarrant counties. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water on roadways is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dallas, Fort Worth, Arlington, Garland, Irving, Grand Prairie, Mesquite, Carrollton, Richardson, Lewisville, Flower Mound, Mansfield, Rowlett, Euless, Desoto, Bedford, Grapevine, Cedar Hill, Haltom City and Wylie.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
